hours_text:
# Visit

## Plan Your Visit

### Hours

  * **Arboretum Gardens**  
Open Daily – 9am – 5pm
  * **Norrie’s Gift & Garden Shop  
**Open Tuesday – Sunday 10am – 4pm 
  * Holiday closures for 2026: Nov. 26 & Nov. 27, Dec. 24-Jan. 1, 2027. 

### Admission

  * $10 adults
  * $8 seniors 65+
  * $5 youth 4-17
  * free to kids under 4

### Payment Options

  * Pay Online at our [Online Store](https://shopucscarboretum.com/collections/garden-admission)
  * Pay in person with **Cash** or Checks payable to UC Regents & Deposit into **Brown “Pay Here** ” Tubes in our Visitor Parking Lot
  * Pay at the [Gift Shop](https://arboretum.ucsc.edu/garden-shop/) during the Shop’s Open Hours

**Enjoy Free Admission if you are:**

  * A current Arboretum Member (with membership card)
  * A current UCSC Student
  * A member of participating AHS/ROAM/NARM Reciprocal Admission Program Garden or Museum with card + ID
  * Those ONLY shopping or picking up an online order at [Norrie’s Gift & Garden Shop](https://shopucscarboretum.com/)
  * Everyone on **Community Day** – all day, the first Tuesday of each month 

[**Pay Admission Online**](https://shopucscarboretum.com/collections/garden-admission)

[**View our MAP and Visitor Guide**](https://arboretum.ucsc.edu/files/2025/09/map-2023-updated-2pages.pdf)

* * *

## Garden Etiquette

**Please help us maintain the peaceful atmosphere** people have come to enjoy. For fire safety and the health of other visitors, there is no smoking.  
  
**To protect our co...

collections_text:
### Where Plants, People, and Possibilities Grow

**[​](https://arboretum.ucsc.edu/visit/)[Join us for a day of service Monday January 19th – In honor of Martin Luther King Jr.](https://arboretum.ucsc.edu/visit/events/)**

Our Mission is to Conserve, Grow, and Share the World of Plants to Build Resilience and Empower the Community in the Stewardship of All Life.

Botanic gardens that center their collections on Mediterranean-climate, drought tolerant plants occupy a special niche in the world of horticulture. Our collections — shaped by these climates from California and the Southern Hemisphere — aren’t just beautiful; they demonstrate extraordinary biodiversity and strategies for surviving dry summers and drought, while providing rich opportunities for research and conservation, and serving an urgent role as public models for water-wise landscapes.

## Discover The Arboretum

[**Get Involved**](https://arboretum.ucsc.edu/get-involved/)

[**What’s Happening**](https://arboretum.ucsc.edu/visit/events/)

[**Gift & Garden Shop**](https://arboretum.ucsc.edu/garden-shop/)

* * *

[**Pay Garden Admission**](https://shopucscarboretum.com/collections/garden-admission)

[**Rent Our Meeting Hall**](https://arboretum.ucsc.edu/rentals/)
